intro: Argostemma streblosifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf argostemma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
